div.p: As a student, you need to be in charge of your education.
That's probably one of the most important things that you can do in order
to be successful in college anywhere.
You need to do your homework- not just in the classroom,
but also before you're coming to see your advisor.
My advisor really helps get me on track.
When I started ACCESS, I knew I needed to go to school, and I had a million ideas of what it was
that I wanted to go to school for, and what I thought I wanted to do.
My advisor was able to sit down with me and talk to me more and find out my interests,
what I want to do with my life, what I was good at-all those things-help me figure
out the right track.
When we picked out my first classes, she really tried to help me pick
out things she knew I would be comfortable with, because these were my first college courses.
It was great.
My first classes were a really great experience for me.
I think I certainly had a million questions for her.
I wanted to know everything, from, Where is the library exactly?, to "How do I get my books?
I had every question in the world, and she was able to answer them.
If she wasn't' able to answer them, she found those answers for me.
It was really great to know that she was trying to get to know me,
and I was able to get all I needed to know from her.
